question: So what days are important in your country?
transcript: I think there is several cultural dates that are celebrated throughout the country. And one of them is Noru's, I guess, which is the start of spring and the beginning of the Persian New Year. And, yeah, that is one of them. The other one is, I think, Char-Sham-Bissuri, that they actually, people, go around the bonfires and, and, and try to gather with families just before Noru's. And this is just, like, this is another special celebration. Right.
transcript_cleaned: I think there is several cultural dates that are celebrated throughout the country. And one of them is Noru's, I guess, which is the start of spring and the beginning of the Persian New Year. And, yeah, that is one of them. The other one is, I think, Char-Sham-Bissuri, that they actually, people, go around the bonfires and, and, and try to gather with families just before Noru's. And this is just, like, this is another special celebration.

question: And what are the benefits of having events that many people around the world are celebrating on the same day?
transcript: Well, if everyone is celebrating on the same day, like date or location, those can be, good indicators of how big that event is. And if something is celebrated across many countries, let us say Christmas Day, or, or Boxing Day across many countries, you have, a higher, like, sense of, it is like, you might feel it is a more, sophisticated thing that it actually is because many, many people are doing it. And, you are not the only one. It might kind of motivate you to do your best to prepare for that holiday. Thank you very much. That is the end of the.
